instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00281: What is 820-00281? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.A1707: What is A1707? A1707 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3072, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00281, 820-00928..
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.PM_EN_P3V3_G3H: What is PM_EN_P3V3_G3H? PM_EN_P3V3_G3H is a signal that enables the PP3V3_G3H rail to turn on. This comes out of ISL9239 or ISL9240 chip; when missing, often is missing because of a bad ISL9239 or ISL9240 chip. .
definitions.R7020: What is R7020? Current sense shunt resistor for the charger, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 27/28 on ISL6259 should give you 20.02 ohms. .

threads.title: (Resolved) <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A only 5V, no 20V. Missing <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Hi all.
I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2016 macbook that is not turning on, either via battery or via genuine known good AC adapter.
No signs of liquid damage.
Missing <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.

Suspecting <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>, but thought I'd get advice first.

Here's a list of what we've checked.

<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> = 5.27v
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 0.23v decreasing
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> Diode mode to ground = 455
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> = 0.05v decreasing
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> = 0v

<SIGNAL>PM_EN_P3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> = 5.04v
<SIGNAL>TBA_AUX_DET</SIGNAL> = 1.3v
<SIGNAL>TBA_VDDA</SIGNAL> = 5.05v
<SIGNAL>TBA_VDDP</SIGNAL> = 5.06v
<RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR> = 5.27v

Diode mode to ground checks on USBC chips:

UB300
<SIGNAL>LDO_3V3</SIGNAL> = 463
<SIGNAL>LDO_1V8A</SIGNAL> = 553
<SIGNAL>LDO_1V8D</SIGNAL> = 505
<SIGNAL>LDO_BMC</SIGNAL> = 548

UB400
<SIGNAL>LDO_3V3</SIGNAL> = 463
<SIGNAL>LDO_1V8A</SIGNAL> = 558
<SIGNAL>LDO_1V8D</SIGNAL> = 505
<SIGNAL>LDO_BMC</SIGNAL> = 552

<CHIP>U3100</CHIP>
<SIGNAL>LDO_3V3</SIGNAL> = 462
<SIGNAL>LDO_1V8A</SIGNAL> = 548
<SIGNAL>LDO_1V8D</SIGNAL> = 503
<SIGNAL>LDO_BMC</SIGNAL> = 542

<CHIP>U3200</CHIP>
<SIGNAL>LDO_3V3</SIGNAL> = 462
<SIGNAL>LDO_1V8A</SIGNAL> = 552
<SIGNAL>LDO_1V8D</SIGNAL> = 504
<SIGNAL>LDO_BMC</SIGNAL> = 546

Voltage measurements on <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>
<SIGNAL>P_IN</SIGNAL> = 5.27v
<SIGNAL>AUX_DET</SIGNAL> = 5.27v
VDDA = 5.05v
VDDP = 5.05v
<SIGNAL>SMC_RST</SIGNAL>* = 0v
<SIGNAL>AUX_OK</SIGNAL> = 0.33v
AMON = 0v
BMON =0v

Any suggestions or advice greatly appreciated.
Thank you.

threads.title: (Resolved) <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A only 5V, no 20V. Missing <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Be sure to use original 87/96W charger.
What is <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage with battery connected?
Don't forget to connect the data cable.
Should be good to test with pre-charged battery.

Check <SIGNAL>SMC_USBC_INT_L</SIGNAL> level.

Any history available?

threads.title: (Resolved) <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A only 5V, no 20V. Missing <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Thanks 2infomaticos.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 11.04v with battery attached, with the data line connected as well.

<SIGNAL>SMC_USBC_INT_L</SIGNAL> = 0.24 with battery
<SIGNAL>SMC_USBC_INT_L</SIGNAL> = 0.04 without battery

No history available, other than the last time the customer used it, it worked.

threads.title: (Resolved) <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A only 5V, no 20V. Missing <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
There is a problem with (at least) one USB-C port.

Board turns on with battery connected?
Use <RESISTOR>R5226</RESISTOR>, or SW5200, for test.

threads.title: (Resolved) <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A only 5V, no 20V. Missing <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Thanks again for your help 2informaticos.

The board did not have <RESISTOR>R5226</RESISTOR> or SW5200.
Both were not populated.

[B]We found <CAPACITOR>C3100</CAPACITOR> was shorted.[/B]
Removed and now get 20v and the board is working correctly.
Boots into OSX OK. 

Thanks, once again for your help, I really appreciate it.

threads.title: (Resolved) <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A only 5V, no 20V. Missing <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
"The board did not have <RESISTOR>R5226</RESISTOR> or SW5200.
Both were not populated."
Of course, these pads are just for test purpose.
